intro: Blepharis hirta var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a suitable climate.
